data.title: Your Honor Season 3: Is the third installment in the making? Latest Updates
data.meta_description: If you're planning a relaxed weekend of streaming, Netflix has got you covered. Richard Linklater's critically acclaimed comedy "Hit Man" has just dropped, all nine seasons of "How I Met Your Mother" have returned, and a lesser-known series, "Your Honor," has recently climbed into the platform's top ten list.
data.text:
Synopsis

If you're planning a relaxed weekend of streaming, Netflix has got you covered. Richard Linklater's critically acclaimed comedy "Hit Man" has just dropped, all nine seasons of "How I Met Your Mother" have returned, and a lesser-known series, "Your Honor," has recently climbed into the platform's top ten list.

As Netflix continues to expand its catalog, fans of the gripping legal drama "Your Honor" are eagerly awaiting news about a potential third season. Starring Bryan Cranston, this series has recently found a new audience on the streaming giant, raising questions about its future.

Cast and Characters:

The series boasts a strong cast alongside Cranston, including Hunter Doohan, Michael Stuhlbarg, Isiah Whitlock Jr., Hope Davis, Sofia Black-D’Elia, and Carmen Ejogo. Notable guest stars such as Margo Martindale, Maura Tierney, and Rosie Perez also contribute to the show’s compelling storytelling.

"Your Honor" originally premiered on Showtime in December 2020. Created by Peter Moffat, the drama revolves around Michael Desiato (played by Cranston), a revered judge whose life is thrown into chaos after his son becomes involved in a fatal hit-and-run accident.

The victim is the son of a feared mob kingpin, setting off a series of events that test the limits of Desiato's morality and judicial integrity. Based on the Israeli series "Kvodo," "Your Honor" has been praised for its intense narrative, although it received mixed reviews, with a 58% score on Rotten Tomatoes' Tomatometer and a 67% audience score, as mentioned in a report by Decider.

Streaming Availability:

For those looking to dive into the drama, both seasons of "Your Honor" are currently available on Netflix in the United States. In addition, the series can be streamed on Paramount+, which offers a subscription for $5.99 per month or $11.99 per month for an ad-free experience with Showtime content included. Amazon Prime Video subscribers can also access "Your Honor" through the Paramount+ add-on, which comes with a free trial for new users.

Prospects for Season 3:

Despite the show's success and the interest it has generated, there are currently no plans for a third season of "Your Honor”, as per the Decider’s report.

In April 2023, Bryan Cranston revealed that while Showtime had expressed some interest in continuing the series, he was more inclined towards a production role rather than reprising his character. Originally intended as a limited series, the renewal for a second season itself was somewhat unexpected.

While the so-called “Netflix Bump” has revived and extended the life of many shows, a third season of "Your Honor" remains highly unlikely at this point.

FAQs:

Are they making season 3 of Your Honor?

Currently, there are no plans for a third season of Your Honor. In April 2023, Cranston revealed that while Showtime had expressed interest in continuing the series, he would prefer to focus on producing the show rather than starring in another season..

Where was Your Honor filmed?

Bryan Cranston's series Your Honor was primarily filmed in New Orleans, featuring key locations such as Uptown and the Lower Ninth Ward to enhance its storytelling.
